noun.description: A water spirit of Scottish folklore, typically taking the form of a horse and reputed to delight in the drowning of travelers.
A sheepdog of an Australian breed with a smooth coat, originally bred from a Scottish collie.

origin: Late 17th century: perhaps from Scottish Gaelic cailpeach, colpach bullock, colt. kelpie (sense 2) apparently comes from the name of a particular bitch, King's Kelpie ( c 1879).
